poem:
"Silent Strife"

Brittle barriers of speech, unjustly imposed,
Upon hands that speak louder, still, silenced.
Indifferent ears, eyes averted from dignity's demand.
But not unseen, the hostile whispers of the system,
Muffling the clear voice of worthiness.
Consigned to silence, yet scribed in court, 
Truth resonates, resoundingly.
Unheard, yet victorious; 
In the dignity of deafness, a triumph loud as thunder.
